note.p: Education: Trinity College, Dublin BA (1830-1836), MA (1846); Edinburgh University (geology and engineering).MA

Career: Appointed to the Geological Survey of Ireland (1838); Curator to the Geological Society of Dublin (1843-1845) and Assistant to Professor Sir John Benjamin MacNeill (179301880), the first Professor of Civil Engineering in Trinity College, Dublin; Professor of Geology, Trinity College, Dublin (1845); Local Director of the Geological Survey of Ireland (1846-1850); Superintendent, Geological Survey of India (1851 - 1876); awarded Gold Medal by the Emperor of Austria (1873); retired and lived in Rugby (1877)
Memberships: Geological Society of Ireland (President 1848-1950); MRIA(1844); FGS (1843); Member of Royal Asiatic Society of Bengal (1857)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Irish Innovators
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
